results.title: Carried away
results.creator_credit: Vonnie von Helmolt, Michael Scott and Destiny Deacon
results.brief_description: A combination of animation and live-action which celebrates the creative process. A stylised exercise using black and white photographs to represent reality and coloured overlays representing flights of fantasy. The artist learns by trial and error to take possession of his creative energy. Useful in the areas of art, media studies and as a stimulus to discussion in English classes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vonnie von Helmolt, Michael Scott and Destiny Deacon

results.title: Carreras, Domingo, Pavarotti in Concert
results.brief_description: This program features Jose Carreras, Placido Domingo and Luciano Pavarotti in concert in Caracalla, Rome, with the Orchestras of Maggio Musicale Fiorenti and Teatro Dell’ Opera di Roma conducted by Zubin Mehta.

results.title: Carnival in Quebec
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A colorful record of Quebec City’s winter carnival - with all the fun and frolic of a southern Mardi Gras but in gleaming winter setting. Fine examples of snow sculpture, pageants, parades, sporting events, a torch-light parade on skis, folk dancing and fireworks, fill three weeks of festivities and pay due respect to King Winter.

results.title: Basilisk stare
results.creator_credit: Chryss Carr, Mis Kamieniak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A psychosexual drama which launches the viewer into the inner-space of the male psyche in order to depict the way the modern male constructs sex. The film excites and disturbs the viewer with the use of a split screen, which allows for the pitching of two images against each other in order to create a sense of both excitement and voyeuristic curiosity.
Cast includes David Wenham, Amy Pedersen and Jared Turner

results.title: Car park
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Leesa Kahn and Darcy Yuille
results.brief_description: Welcome to the world of Car Park - a multi-layered absurdist satire on the nature of relationships, communication and finding a parking space when you need one.

results.title: Birthday boy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Gregory and Sejong Park
results.brief_description: Korea 1951 - little Manuk is playing on the streets of his village and dreaming of life at the front where his father is a soldier. He returns home to find a parcel on the doorstep and, thinking it is a birthday present, he opens it. But its contents will change his life.

results.title: The Other son
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Rachel Roberts and Heng Tang
results.brief_description: Vera is the meticulous wife, mother and reigning matriarch of her palatial home. She manages her domestic domain with digital clockwork precision. It is 7pm and dinner time. Her dutiful husband and beautiful son take their designated places at the table. However, the tranquillity is interrupted by the sudden appearance of an intruder threatening to shatter Vera’s utopia. Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: Pending
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Paola Garofali and Anna Tow
results.brief_description: In this fantasy animation, Jasmine flees her war-torn country for the safety of the towering City of Anchors. But between her traumatic past and her hopes for a new life, Jasmine must first face a heartless Immigration Department bureaucrat and persuade him to let her stay. Original Format 35 mm/colour.

results.title: Placement
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Sarah Warner and Bill Chen
results.brief_description:
Sometime in the future, Max lives with his only daughter, Ruby, in an apartment complex where he spends all his time working. But his life is shattered when Ruby chases her balloon off the edge and falls to the street below.
He is offered the chance to clone her and puts his strong religious beliefs aside in order to have his daughter back, but the new Ruby is not the same.

results.title: Carnival of souls
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1960s, a horror/thriller about a young woman who, when a car she is riding in hurtles off a bridge during a drag race, survives despite the other two passengers perishing. Mary Henry’s inability to remember anything about her ordeal doesn’t stop her ambition to become a church organist in Utah. Apparitions of a ghostly zombie (played by director Herk Harvey) begin to appear and her failed attempts to ignore him tell us something more sinister is at play than B-grade 1960s horror. The fascination with an abandoned carnival, her indifference to spirituality and religion and her lack of interest in the jovial and sleazy neighbour Mr. Linden reflect the discontinuity of her life following the accident. The subtle use of an organ throughout the soundtrack maintains a constant state of tension and suspense and adds to the religious and morbid undertones. Harvey uses dreamlike sequences, where Mary enters a ghost world and cannot be seen or heard, which effectively highlights her feelings of marginalisation and creates an image of hysteria and mass paranoia - an effect which has become cliche in horror and suspense. The abandoned carnival which fills Mary with guilt and fear represents her deserted dead girlfriends - the cinematography which conjures up Hitchcock’s use of shots featuring the individual enclosed within their environment to create a sense of loneliness, as in Vertigo and Frenzy. Hilligoss’ (Mary Henry) amateur performance sees her immaculately make the transformation from a confused yet strong willed character to a maniacal woman who can’t escape her demons while sparing watchers too many dramatic exaggerated facial close-ups. Harvey’s story of a woman’s psychological existence between the two worlds of life and death suggests influences for Lynch, ‘Night of the living dead’ and ‘The Sixth sense’. Cast includes: Candace Hilligoss, Frances Feist, Sidney Berger, Art Ellison.
